description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
CrowdStrike is seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will work with a world-class team of engineers to analyze vast amounts of data and make discoveries.
About the team:
You will be joining to the EASM Engineering team a.k.a. CrowdStrike Falcon Surface
Falcon Surface pinpoints unknown, exposed internet-facing assets so security teams can best secure their digital perimeter. It enables security teams to detect, prioritize, and manage all of their exposed internet-facing assets that are centralized or remote across on-premise environments, subsidiary, cloud and third-party vendors with no agents or deployment required.
More information about Falcon Surface
https://www.crowdstrike.com/products/security-and-it-operations/falcon-surface

Description:
As part of the EASM Engineering team a.k.a. Falcon Surface, you will be involved in continuous data improvement, identify online assets, and take part in defining the latest product requirements and changes.
You will be a team member that gathers and delivers data and intelligence to help organizations.
Interviewing process: online
Key responsibilities:
Enhance the accuracy of data by contributing to our platform’s asset association techniques
Extract insights from large databases, as well as identify anomalies in large datasets
Contribute to the classification and security scanning capabilities of CrowdStrike’s Falcon platform
Collaborate with several teams to help define cross-platform security features
Conduct web research for solutions and identifications of common web services
Participate in the architectural security reviews of immensely scaled CrowdStrike products
Job requirements:
5+ years of experience as a data analyst
Knowledge of computer networking and web technologies like cloud computing, applications, and servers
Scripting skills, with Python preferred
Experience working with a database
Experience with Linux or Unix-like operating systems
Self-starting learner with the ability to adapt to multiple requirements
Demonstrable critical thinking skills
Excellent communication and team collaboration skills
Ability to write coherent reports with key takeaways and suggestions
Fluency in English
Additional preferences:
Experience working with ElasticSearch and Kibana is preferred but not required
Experience working with data analytics in the cybersecurity landscape is preferred but not required
If you're passionate about cybersecurity and have a strong background in data science or data analysis, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join CrowdStrike as a Senior Data Analyst.
#LI-DS1
#LI-YA1
#LI-MZ1
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:
Remote-first culture
Market leader in compensation and equity awards
Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
Physical and mental wellness programs
Paid parental leave, including adoption
A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities
Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration
We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.Show more Report

About DoorLoopCertified as a Great Place to Work®, DoorLoop is a property management software used by landlords and property managers in over 100 countries.As a software company with $30M in funding, 3 offices worldwide (Miami, London, Israel), and tens of thousands of units being managed, we are one of the fastest growing tech companies.If you want to work with a team that values transparency, feedback, and growth, DoorLoop is for you.The RoleWe are looking for a super talented Senior Data Analyst to join our team in Tel-Aviv. If you are excited about what you are about to read, we invite you to apply!We are looking for someone who has a good understanding of relational databases, hands-on experience in SQL and/or Python, and data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI. You will be working closely with the product, marketing, customer success, and engineering teams, to improve conversions, LTV, churn, product A/B tests, and more. You will collect and analyze the data and help answer the toughest issues each team is facing in order to drive insights..Some additional qualities about you and this role:You will identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets to drive actionable insights.You will define and implement KPIs across different teams: product, business, marketing, and customer success.You will implement product features, measure their performance, and provide recommendations.Gain a deeper understanding of how customers use our product, and advise us on how to improve.You will translate product/business requirements, and create a clear visualization which "tells the story" using a BI tool or other platformQualifications & Requirements4+ years of experience as a Data/Business Analyst.B.S in one of the following: Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.An ability to understand complex business models and simplifyExperience in product analysis including working with BI events and performing A/B tests.High level of SQL is a must.Experience in BI visualization tools such as Tableau, Amplitude, or similar and performing A/B tests.Experience in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousingTeam player, effective interpersonal skills, and good vibes. Ability to manage relationships with key partners and the ability to work independently.Experience in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.Bonus PointsExperience in Python is a plus, but not a must.Experience working with Salesforce is a plus, but not a must.Benefits & PerksUnlimited paid time off with unlimited personal, vacation, and sick days.Annual company retreat in the US with our Miami team (all expenses paid).Career development with unlimited access to Udemy's courses and other growth opportunities.Monthly investment classes from our co-founders on how to invest your money in a diversified portfolio of real estate, stocks, crypto, NFT, & more.No micromanagement - We believe responsible people thrive on freedom.Great equipment - Ergonomic chairs, Mac or PC laptops, dual monitors, standup desks, and more.No rules - No dress code, policies, or handbooks. Just do great work & have fun!Job Type: Full-timeAbility to commute/relocate:תל אביב -יפו, מחוז תל אביב: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Show more Report

Compiling, analyzing, and reporting data. Investigation of data anomalies. Analyze large datasets, and provide useful actionable recommendations. Provide supporting data for prioritizing new features and initiatives.

Analyze product behavior and performance for configuration tuning per customer. Finding influencing factors and estimate their effect on the KPIs. Bachelor degree in Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, ora related field Good numerical reasoning skills Expert level in Excel High level of spoken and written English. Team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skillsReport

About the department
About Research department-The research department is responsible for the

analysis of players research, competitive offering

and market trends.
Responsibilities
As a Junior Survey Analyst, the new team member will perform
customer research, based on questionnaires for product and marketing departments.
The researcher will present the findings to the internal
customer and deliver a structured report.
What we expectQuestionnaire writing experience -Must!!!Perform statistical analysis of surveys.Qualitative research as well; playtests, interviews,
diaries, etc.
Presenting reports to all levels of managementWork with a wide range of internal clients
DesiredAdvantage – Experience in Gaming companiesExperience with data analysis: Excel, SPSS, R,
Python
Experience with Power PointAdvantage: Background in academic research
What we offer our Employees
Your wellbeing: Flexible, hybrid work experience with talented professionals. Also, high work life balance derived from our people-oriented approach
Your health: top notch health insurance to employees and immediate family. Furthermore, gym membership or a variety or workout options
Your future: personal and professional tools to assist with your development and journey
Your contribution: A variety of social and charitable initiatives, that we take pride in
Your home away from home: A newly renovated office that includes breakfast every morning, a barista to give you your coffee during your workday, an in house gym and workout studio to balance all the delicious food and if you are a musician a fully equipped music room to play around in
And an opportunity to work with the best of the best locally and globally in the gaming fieldReport

חברה מבוססת וחדשנית באזור המרכז מגייסת Data Analyst. במסגרת התפקיד, ניתוח נתונים, זיהוי מגמות והזדמנויות חדשות ב-Data, הגדרת מטרות עסקיות, עבודה עם כלי אנליזה, ועוד! הזדמנות להיות חלק בחברה מצליחה ולהשתלב בתפקיד בעל אתגר מקצועי. - SQL ברמה גבוהה - ידע ב-Python - תואר רלוונטי - עבודה עם כלי אנליזה וויזואליזציית נתונים: BOXI, PWBIShow more Report

At Nym, we’re passionate about simplifying healthcare by automating the accurate interpretation of clinical language.
Our interdisciplinary team has developed an innovative technology that can understand clinical language and provides an entirely new way of analyzing and decoding medical records into clear, concise, and actionable information. This ultimately ensures clinical and administrative teams can spend more time focused on patient care.
At Nym, the future is bright. Our engine currently processes over five million charts annually in more than 150 emergency department and urgent care settings across the US. We are backed by top-tier VCs and growing rapidly, with offices in NYC and Tel Aviv.
Come join us!
Role and Responsibilities:
Nym is looking for a Medical Data Analyst to join our growing Implementation group, reporting to our Squad Lead. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of new clients and analyzing both historical and real-time client data while supporting the on-going configuration of Nym’s CLU engine according to the client’s needs and specifications.
As a Medical Data Analyst, you will:
Analyze and understand clients’ business objectives and needs while customizing Nym’s CLU engine accordingly.
Ensure the successful integration of Nym’s products for the client.
Support Nym’s clients throughout the technical integration process, including identifying bugs and recommending fixes and improvements.
Work with our multidisciplinary R&D team (Software Engineers, Linguists and Medical Doctors, Product team, and Customer Success team.
Provide technical solutions for alerts and incoming escalated tickets from our customers, including extensive troubleshooting and root cause assessment.
Find workarounds and solutions for technical challenges – doing whatever it takes for the customer to get the best service out of our product.
Perform configuration changes, deployments, and product expansions for our customers.
Develop automation tools and scripts to make your work more efficient.
Requirements:

Hands-on SQL or Pandas skills.
Familiarity with medical terminology.
Ability to work as part of a team in a fast-growing start-up.
High performer in challenging situations.
Fluent in English – both written and spoken.
Python knowledge and experience- Strong advantage.Report

Finaro is a global cross-border payment and banking solutions provider empowering international commerce through brilliantly simple payments.
Our passionate team, exceptional tech capabilities, product innovation, and customer-centric approach drive us to simplify complexity and create multidimensional solutions that generate growth and give our customers peace of mind. At Finaro we manage critical internet-scale finance transaction services. Stability is a core value, and the BizOps analyst’s main responsibility is to deliver information-based analytics to achieve stability.
As part of our continued growth, we are looking for a BizOps Analyst student (60%).
In this role, you will operate Finaro’s core systems, analyze data lakes, build new monitoring methods and deliver better visibility and stability to Finaro’s information services.
Responsibilities:
Develop methods with IT and business units to support the information system’s stability.
Monitor business applications’ health using a variety of technologies.
Become an application expert and support business issues and bugs around it
Build Kibana (ELK) base dashboards and SQL-based reports.
Analyze systems malfunctions in real-time using multiple analyzing and Big data tools.
Produce Root Cause Analysis post incidents and manage the process of proper fixes and future mitigation.
Manage real-time incidents, communicate with IT operators, Business users, and management, act as a focal point and lead the incident to proper resolution in the most responsible manner.
Requirements:

Analyst - Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyze significant amounts of information with accuracy.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to details
SQL - mandatory. Firm knowledge in SQL coding.
Kibana – knowledge in Kibana analysis, create reports/dashboards - advantage
Resilient – be able to sustain critical incidents.
Possess excellent organizational and interpersonal communication skills.
Working in a Production environment – a strong advantage
B.Sc. in Industrial Engineering/math/information system or other quantitative fieldsShow more Report

job: Data Analyst Engineering Entry-level Full-time Details
description:
Rewire is a young and dynamic start-up creating an International Financial Services Platform for migrants. Rewire provides a game-changing, all-in-one, transparent, cost-effective, and simple solution. The BI team supports the firm's growth plans and enhances its position as a market leader.
We are looking for a business analyst who lives and breathes data to join our BI team and become our Israel business unit department analyst!
Someone eager to learn and with a true passion for the data industry. Can see beyond numbers, ask the right business questions and is curious to investigate and gain insights, ready to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities. As a Data Analyst, you will directly impact the company’s business performance by delivering valuable insights and analysis.
You will:
Work closely with multiple departments, translate complex data into actionable insights, and identify areas of optimization and growth.
Provide analytical support for management’s decision-making.
Design and create BI dashboards, reports, and ad-hoc analyses to provide insights and business performance monitoring.
Weekly cadence of Biz readings both wide and deep dive to support our Biz decisions.
Real time view to help us monitor our IL activity and performance.
Support Biz model creations and potential Biz opportunities.
Work closely with the Marketing, Community team and CX team to process and provide insights to customer behavior and preference.
Creating and maintaining with the Community team, Product and Marketing competitive analysis framework to monitor our position in the market, possible threats and opportunities.
Maintain our unit economics view and management.
REQUIREMENTS
B.Sc. in Industry & Management, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or equivalent
2-3 years experience working as a data-analyst or business analyst.
Experience working with BI visualization platforms (Looker, PBI, Tableau etc.)
Basic sql knowledge.
Able to model and transform data and present data in a useful business context.
Business oriented view.
Ability to translate business requirements into technical requirements.
Strong "storyteller" that can leverage data and analytics in a business environment to influence decision making
Independent
Excellent communication skills with fluent English - MUST
Advantage:
Hands-on experience with Looker.
Experience working in the fintech industry.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzingShow more Report

At Datagen, we’re simulating the world for producing high-performance synthetic data to develop the next generation of computer vision AI applications. We work with some of the most innovative companies in the world in domains like automotive, AR/VR, home security, robotics, retail, and more. We’re looking for talented people who want to take a key part in pushing forward this amazing new technology.
We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with the different teams to proactively find and act on existing opportunities, using the most powerful resource - data. You should have a strong analytical background, high proficiency in SQL and data visualization, and a strong understanding of business processes. You can tell the story behind complicated numbers in a simple way, and use quantitative analysis methods to do so exceptionally.

In this role, you will:

Extract and analyze datasets using BI tools to drive key business decisions.
Build reports, dashboards, and metrics, in addition to monitoring the integrity and validity of the data reported.
Use Snowflake to build ad-hoc queries to investigate the underlying data and provide on the go answers.
See beyond numbers and help to inform, influence, support, and execute our business decisions.
Identify data anomalies and make recommendations to support new and existing business processes.
Uncover actionable insights and make recommendations that will influence the company's strategic and tactical decisions.
Monitor key metrics, identify business trends and forecasts.

For this role, you must have:

3+ years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst or a similar role (preferably with a B2B).
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. engineering, sciences, math, statistics, business, or economics).
Fully proficient in SQL and MS Excel, with high-level analytical and problem-solving skills, and exceptional attention to detail.
Strong data reporting and visualization experience (e.g. Tableau,Qlik Sense, PowerBI).
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and actionable insights to a range of stakeholders.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

Even better if you have:

Experience with Tableau.
Experience with Snowflake or other cloud-based services.
Experience with Python, R, or any other scripting language.
Datagen is committed to being an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, religion, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.Show more Report

העובד/ת י/תשמש כאנליסט/ית בצוות אנליזה וניהול המידע באגף מערכות מידע, בכפיפות לר"צ אנליזה וניהול המידע. האנליסט/ית י/תהיה אחראי/ת על שליפות מידע וניתוח הנתונים עבור המנהלים הבכירים במטה ובארגון מכלל החטיבות (רפואה, תפעול, סיעוד ושירות/שיווק), וכן הוספת תובנות עסקיות מתוך ראייה תהליכית רחבה. העובד/ת י/תהווה אוטוריטה מקצועית בנושא כריית הנתונים (נאמן מידע) במחלקת דאטה ואנליטיקה עבור כלל האנליסטים בארגון. הגדרת דרישות עסקיות מול לקוחות והפקת מידע רלוונטי בהתאם לדרישות, מתוך הבנה לעומק של התהליכים העסקיים הקיימים בארגון, וכן ראייה רחבה לצורך מענה מיטבי ומדויק.

ניתוח נתונים בהתאם לדרישה וכן פרו-אקטיבי על ידי כריית נתונים, ניתוחם ויצירת תובנות עסקיות ללקוח היכרות מיטבית עם מחסן הנתונים וביזור המידע בארגון לכלל האנליסטים בארגון יישום והטמעת מתודולוגיות עבודה ובקרה על שלמות המידע שימוש נרחב בכלי SSBI השכלה אקדמאית במדעי המחשב / בהנדסת תוכנה/ הנדסת תעו"נ / מתמטיקה / הנדסאי תוכנה - חובה ניסיון קודם של שנתיים לפחות כ-DATA ANALYST - חובה ידע וניסיון מוכח ב- SQL ברמה גבוהה (כולל שאילתות מורכבות, פונקציות שונות) - חובה ידע וניסיון מוכח ב-Excel ברמה גבוהה (VLOOKUP, נוסחאות מורכבות וכו') - חובה הכרות עם כלי תחקור שונים (PowerBI, Qlik וכו') - יתרון ידע וניסיון ב-Python - יתרוןShow more Report

ארגון פיננסי מוביל בתחומו במרכז מחפש Business data analyst למחלקת ה-Bi. התפקיד כולל פיתוח והפקת דוחות ב-Bo ובאקסל, שליפת נתוני שאילתות מידע מורכבות מבסיסי נתונים שונים. כמו כן, פיתוח דשבורדים למשתמשים העסקיים ואפיון צרכים של משתמשי הדוחות. - ניסיון של שנתיים לפחות ב-SQL - ניסיון של שנתיים לפחות בניתוח נתונים - ניסיון של שנתיים לפחות באקסל ברמה גבוהה ובoffice -ניסיון של שנתיים לפחות בעבודה עם בסיסי נתונים טבלאיים (יתרון לteradata)Show more Report

כאנאליסט תעזור ותתמוך בבניה וניהול מוצרי הליבה הדיגיטליים, תוך תמיכה בהמשכיות עסקית ,צמיחת החברה וסיפוק מענה לצרכי הלקוחות.

עבודה מול אגפים עסקיים – ליווי, הכוונה ושיתוף בתוצרים ובתובנותShow more Report

About the role:
This role contains a critical component in AI-driven machine learning. We are looking for a precise and object-oriented individual in the quantitive field of data classification to join our team.
Our insight is to train AI/ML algorithms to provide our clients with precise predictions.
As a data analyst, you will annotate, create and analyze various complicated datasets and draw intelligent conclusions to support our mission.
Requirements:

Experience of 2+ years with writing SQL queries
Experience of 2+ years with Python (Pandas, NumPy)
Experience in data tagging
Experienced in work with 3rd party service providers
Goals-oriented team player
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analytical strategiesShow more Report

nSure.ai is an advanced payment fraud prevention platform for sellers of digital goods, gaming, crypto, and fintech. Its bespoke ML models help merchants to realize their true business potential, increase revenue, decrease costs, minimize churn, and mitigate fraud expenses.
As a Product Data Analyst, you will proactively guide business growth based on data analysis and statistical research, and have a significant impact on decision making. Conduct end-to-end data analysis that includes requirement specification and data collection, pre-processing, analysis, in addition to owning ongoing deliverables and presentations.
You will explore and investigate creative solutions for a variety of unprecedented challenges with the objective of constantly improving performance. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy as well as define KPIs to measure product and initiative performances.
You will take ownership by working independently as well as leading large projects with significant potential impact, through collaboration with internal stakeholders to ensure delivery of the intended outcomes.
#LI-Hybrid
Requirements:

What you'll need to be a successful Product Analyst at nSure.ai:
Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Industrial engineering or a related field.
2+ years of experience as a product analyst - a must.
Detail oriented.
Loves working with numbers.
SQL & Python experience
Passionate about understanding how the business works, curious and eager to stay on top of changes in a fast paced business environment.
Proactive, independent and communicative.
Fast learner, natural curiosity and intellectual horsepower to deeply understand new topics and pick up new skills in a very short time.
Strategic problem solver
Creative, someone who is able to come up with different interpretations for the same data.
Loves the startup spirit and would like to join the ride.Show more Report

Join a team that is changing millions of lives.
Transforming smiles. Transforming lives. Transforming an industry.
At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.
Ready to join us?
About this opportunity
This role focus on learning from our install base, helping us improving our quality and customer experience.
The Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. He/she will develop analysis and reporting capabilities, monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques
Developing and implementing data analyses and data collection systems
In this role, you will…
Interpret data, analyze results related to our install base
Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reports
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources working closely with BI team
Create dashboard and ad hoc reports to the customer satisfaction team
Filter and “clean” data by working closely with the professional services team for NPI projects
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Define new data collection and analysis process to improve our visibility to our Install base
Forecasting and preparations for long terms for service and business aspects
Improve customers utilization by review trends and changes
Implement new method and tools such as machine learning, Azure, etc, and look for opportunities for new technologies
In this role, you’ll need …
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst 1 years
BSc in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics or similar.
Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skillswith the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong communication skills, working with global teams and clearly presenting data and findings
Strong technical knowledge and understanding of our platforms and flows
Knowledge in Power BI/ Tableau or any other data visualization SW
SW Develop skills – advantage
Experience with Big Data – advantage
Familiar with Databricks / AWS services – advantage
Knowledge of Python/spark – advantage
Sound like a good fit?
Great! Click the Apply link below to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, there are lots more opportunities. Please consider sharing this opportunity with others in your network.
About Align
Invisalign clear aligners, iTero Intraoral scanners, and OrthoCAD digital services that help dental professionals achieve the clinical results they expect and deliver effective, cutting-edge dental options to their patients.Show more Report

One Zero is looking for an individual with a strong attention to detail and a passion for customer service to join our dynamic team as a Quality Assurance (QA) Data Analyst. The successful candidate will be responsible for executing manual tests, analyzing results, reporting observations, and collaborating with cross-functional teams such as Back Office and Engineering to improve our internal products. We are looking for experienced Fraud & Data experts to join Identiq’s Analytics team!
Identiq’s Fraud Analytics team is key to the success of Identiq and our customers. In this role, you will be best positioned to impact our product and how our customers benefit from it.
If you are excited about data and love to have a significant impact wherever you are, then come help us transform how fraud risk management is done around the world!
Requirements:

2+ years experience working with and analyzing large, complex data sets
2+ years experience in fraud and risk management - an advantage
Hands-on experience with SQL and R/Python
A customer-oriented, collaborative and proactive attitude
Very high proficiency in English - verbal and written
Experience in working with Sales teams - an advantage
Willingness to travel abroad occasionally
Ability to work in flexible hours
Responsibilities:

In the first 6 months, your main mission is to successfully show the value of our product by running evaluation analyses with our strategic clients.
In your role, you will be working with customers, development, and customer success teams, to guarantee the successful onboarding and fraud prevention benefits of Identiq’s customers while providing insight to the Identiq product and development teams.
During this time, your day-to-day will include the following challenges:
Perform comprehensive analysis in order to demonstrate the benefits of the Identiq network to our strategic customers.
Work with the Risk teams of our strategic customers to help them fully onboard into the network and make sure their use of it is optimal
Find creative solutions to complex problems, involving a deep understanding of both technical, business, and analytical objectives
Identify, prioritize, track, and communicate data issues internally and externally
Collaborate with a team of A-player analysts and engineers to help develop the next generation of Identiq’s solutions
As Identiq moves into later product stages, our team’s mission will expand to supporting other analytic domains according to company needs (research, client support, etc), and your knowledge and drive will guide our product’s evolution.
About Us:

Identiq is a fast-growing startup set to change the fraud prevention and identity verification market. Unlike traditional identity verification vendors, the Identiq protocol can validate users’ identities without exposing any personal data whatsoever, guaranteeing absolute end-user privacy. The largest companies in the world are joining us these days to form the first fully anonymous global identity verification network. Imagine companies being able to treat new customers as if they have been knowing them for years while creating a better user experience.
Why join Identiq?:

We are creating the world’s first network for Anonymous User Verification, a brand new paradigm in the fraud-fighting space
You’ll get the chance to work with a highly experienced and knowledgeable team, dedicated to helping foster your personal and professional growth
We strive to do what is right, even if it’s not what is easy, and we absolutely love itShow more Report

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Tableau
Experience with the product life-cycle / working with Product teams
Experience with BigQuery
Experience scripting in Python

Be the focal point for all data-related tasks within the Research Group
Own the communication with the annotation team and manage their workflow
Work closely with other members of the group to create dashboards and reports across our products
Perform ad-hoc performance analysis of new algorithms to support product and business decisionsReport

About the Company
At Tectu, you can make a real impact! As a Data & BI Analyst you will play a lead role in delivering data and business strategies, solutions and processes to support the data oriented projects. The ideal candidate is passionate about delivering cutting edge solutions to support the changing business needs and technology landscape. You will be working closely with others on our Product and Engineering teams to define and deliver these solutions.
If you are data obsessed, passionate about technology, self-motivated and a disciplined freelancer, we would love to speak with you. The ideal candidate has both a willingness and desire to work in a dynamic environment, is able to apply Agile methodologies in day-to-day activities, and who enjoys working both independently with little oversight and in a team environment.
About the Role
At Tectu, we work with various customers, providing advanced tech solutions to solve different problems and needs. As a Data & BI analyst at Tectu, your day will most likely vary according to which projects you’re involved in, but generally you’ll be performing the following activities:
Identifying or diagnosing a problem to analyze
Collecting appropriate data from various sources
Cleaning and preparing the data for analysis
Analyzing the data for insights, patterns, or trends
Interpreting the results of the analysis with reports and dashboards
Collaborating with stakeholders and presenting key findings
Responsibilities:
Be an integral part of the team defining data strategy and capabilities roadmap for various customers
Work closely with data engineers to effectively plan and build data engineering tools, data warehouses and data lakes
Provide core contributions to multiple products, projects, solutions and processes through all stages of the development lifecycle
Perform analysis to assess quality and meaning of data
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Use data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, Qlik) to build dashboards and drive insights
Analyze local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry
Prepare reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Qualifications
Requirements:
5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst and Data Analyst
2+ years of experience in advanced analytic related multivariate and A/B testing, digital revenue attribution, cohort analysis, lifetime value analysis, media mix optimization, customer segmentation, and marketing effectiveness
3+ years of experience working with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, QlikSense, etc
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Strong analytical skills and SQL proficiency
Technical proficiency regarding database / DWH design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages to be used for data set analysis
Adept at using data processing platforms like Spark & Presto
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions
Accuracy and attention to detail
Adept at queries, writing reports, and data visualization
Soft Skills:
Strong work ethic and strong core values (honesty, integrity, creativity)
Sense of urgency, ownership mindset, and customer focus
Innovative problem solver who takes initiative never stops thinking about ways to improve
Ability to self-learn new skills and technologies
Advantage:
BSc in highly-quantitative field (Analytics, Computer Science, Industrial Eng, Mathematics, EE) is preferred
Data driven mindset
Able to create and communicate the 'big picture' in a clear way.
Familiar with best practices of the data and software engineering lifecycle
Knowledge of programming languages like Python, R, MATLAB, or otherReport

In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we haven't stopped growing since!

We are looking for a Data Analyst !

What does the day to day of a Data Analyst (Advisory Services) at Similarweb look like:

Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis and data mining to turn data into insights.

Create custom reports according to strategic clients business needs.

Experience in Python scripting - Must
Excellent verbal and communication skills (in English) - Must

Team player, autodidact, fast learner with excellent analytical, research and business skills.

Why you'll love being a Similarwebber:

You'll actually love the product you work with: Our customers aren't our only raving fans. When we asked our employees why they chose to come work at Similarweb, 99% of them said "the product." Imagine how exciting your job is when you get to work with the most powerful digital intelligence platform in the world.

You'll find a home for your big ideas: We encourage an open dialogue and empower employees to bring their ideas to the table. You'll find the resources you need to take initiative and create meaningful change within the organization.

We offer competitive perks & benefits: We take your well-being seriously, and offer competitive compensation packages to all employees. We also put a strong emphasis on community, with regular team outings and happy hours.

You can grow your career in any direction you choose: Interested in becoming a VP or want to transition into a different department? Whether it's Career Week, personalized coaching, or our ongoing learning solutions, you'll find all the tools and opportunities you need to develop your career right here.

Diversity isn't just a buzzword: People want to work in a place where they can be themselves. We strive to create a workplace that is reflective of the communities we serve, where everyone is empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are committed to inclusivity across race, gender, ethnicity, culture, sexual orientation, age, religion, spirituality, identity and experience. We believe our culture of equality and mutual respect also helps us better understand and serve our customers in a world that is becoming more global, more diverse, and more digital every day.Show more Report
